intro: Mitracarpus dregeanus, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from spring to summer. Its fruit is a unique, spiny capsule that splits open to release seeds. Mitracarpus dregeanus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
